#include <stdio.h>
double dArr[5] = { 0.0, 1.1, 2.2, 3.3, 4.4 }, // Initialize an array and *dPtr = dArr; // a pointer to its first // element. int i = 0; // An index variable. dPtr = dPtr + 1; // Advance dPtr to the second element. dPtr = 2 + dPtr; // Addends can be in either order. // dPtr now points to dArr[3].
printf( "%.1f\n", *dPtr ); // Print the element referenced by dPtr. printf( "%.1f\n", *(dPtr -1) ); // Print the element before that, without // modifying the pointer dPtr. i = dPtr - dArr; // Result: the index of the // array element that dPtr points to. printf( "%.d\n", i ); // Print the index (3).
